result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos J. Cabrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not perform 10 hours of community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with J.H. unless approved by the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:14 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights previously filed.  VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 9 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week, or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; maintain absolute sobriety; no contact with J.H. unless approved by the agent; DNA sample and surchrage; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:23 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:44 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time set for FPT. 
State notes parties have an agreement. 
COURT questions def re: agreement. 
Def rquests alternate sentence. 
COURT notes it is unable to continue with plea as there is no agreement. 
COURT sets CC on 3/2/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
COURT leaves jury trial on the calendar at this time. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 3:49 pm
